applicationSteps.text: E-Visa Create an account on this website
applicationSteps.note: This is the on official governmental website
Make sure to remeber your username and password

applicationSteps.text: Pay using a Visa card, MasterCard or other debit cards
Await approval via email, then download and print the e-Visa from your account.

generalNotes.text:
Some the countries don't have the option to fill out online so those
countries have to submit it physically to the Egyptian Embassy
or Counslate (Contact the Egyptian embassy in your country).

The countries filling the E visa online will need to show all original
documents at the time of immigration. Please bring the original
documnets that are needed.

It is recommended that please contact the Egyptian Embassy or
Consulate office in your own country to avoid any type of error
and delay in the visa process.

Tourist Visa.title: Tourist Visa
Tourist Visa.description: Details and Documents required for Tourist Visa (Normal Visa Issued for tourism)

requirements.text: Original Passport with at least 2 blank pages and validity of 6 months from the date of travel.
Bank statement of the past six months.
Self Declaration (performa issued by the Embassy)
Visa Fees (Online or offline depend on the country)
Return Ticket (Will be asked at immigration desk)
Fight Tickets to Egypt (Depend upon the country)

generalNotes.text:
To start the visa process there is no online method everything will be done by the Egyptian
Embassy in your country. (It is recommended to take assistance from a trusted travel
agency).

The documents mention here and the visa booklet may differ from country to country so make
sure to have the details from the Embassy in your country.

The return ticket from Egypt to your home country is compulsory for all countries and it will be
checked on the immigration desk. Make sure you book it before coming to Egypt.

Some of the documents for some countries will need to be notarized by the government before
submitting for the visa so please start the process at your earliest.

Take the details of the documents which will be needed at the time of immigration from the
Egyptian Embassy.

Visa on Arrival.title: Visa on Arrival
Visa on Arrival.description: Details Documents required for Visa on Arrival

Invitation Letter ( Issued by AIESEC Egypt)
Visa fee in Euros or US dollars ( 25$ single entry,60$ multiple entry)

generalNotes.text:
There is no 100% guarantee that a visa on arrival will be issued once you are in Egypt, so if there is an
any other pre-visa option available please go for it.

Fee must be paid in euros or dollars only ( no exchange for any other currency at Egyptian airports)
sometimes in some countries cash option is also not available you only have to pay online.

The visa queue might be long and the immigration process may take hours although in the same
charge other pre-visa can be taken.

Visa Extension protocol.title: Visa Extension protocol
Visa Extension protocol.description: Details Documents required for Visa on Arrival

requirements.text: The existing e-visa that you used to enter and stay in Egypt.
The fees for a visa extension in cash. (about 45 $ you may need to pay several fees for ex: late application fees, etc)
Address in Egypt where you are currently staying (Accommodation details)

generalNotes.text: visa extension for three more months, and no other validity is available. The e-visa extension is called Foreign Residence Card. It will be issued in the form of a plastic card.
you are allowed 2 weeks of overstay on your egypt visa without fines or consequences being imposed on you

Usually, applicants need to visit the office twice. The first time, they fill out the e-visa application form in person and submit the required documents, including a photograph and fee payment. They will also get their biometrics done on the first visit. On your second visit, typically the next day of your first visit, you will pay visa processing fees before getting the visa extension.
please remember that this process cannot be completed online, and you need to visit the relevant department in person to get your e-visa extended or renewed.

The Egyptian Passports, Immigration, and Nationality Administration office is where you will visit and submit the visa renewal application. It is located in the Police Academy, Abbasiya, Cairo. You can visit the office between 8 a.m. to 2 p.m. daily except for Friday, and Saturday is dedicated to pickups.
Or you can visit the Mugamma Building located in Tahrir Square, Cairo. It is open from 8:00 a.m. to 3:30 p.m.

If You Overstay Your Egypt visa This can lead to drastic consequences such as a fine or travel ban. If the government decides to ban you from entering Egypt, you will not be able to get a travel permit in the future or as long as the ban stays

Overstaying your e-visa in Egypt can result in a fine. The amount you need to pay depends on the duration of visa expiration and the length of time you have overstayed in Egypt. Generally,overstaying your visa for up to three months will result in a USD 100 penalty. If you overstayed for over three months, you would be charged accordingly.

The fines will be paid at the airport when you leave Egypt. This could take some time as the airports are busy areas, so you might need to wait for your turn in the queue. Therefore, we suggest you arrive at the airport well ahead of your flight so that you have enough time to pay the fine, clear customs and other security procedures, and board the plane on time.
